title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Employment Minister Michaelia Cash has lashed out at Anthony Albanese’s quest for job creation, telling media “Australians have the right to be sceptical” when they hear the Labor leader speak of “job creation and a strong economy”. “Just a few months ago Anthony Albanese was enthusiastically campaigning to impose an additional $387 billion of taxes on the Australian people and the economy,” she said. “Imagine the devastating effect that would have on job creation.” The WA senator’s comments follow Anthony Albanese’s first major speech as Labor leader, in which he vowed to implement ‘Jobs and Skills Australia’, a body designed to better match what is being taught in skills and vocation with what industry actually needs. Image: News Corp Australia
